frameDefinitions: In a text, a Source_of_information is given that provides a reader of the text with further Information relevant to the text.

This frame concerns Acts and State_of_Affairs for which Protagonists are responsible and which either follow or violate some set of rules  or Norms. '' 'A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money violates the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.'
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.
A Reader visually examines a Text, typically in a linear order, to understand its content.
A Total has a Part, either  as a member of an aggregate or as  a constituent part of a simple entity.
frameExamples: In Densmore's days it was sometimes made of an old-fashioned man's celluloid collar (<t>cf.</t> Densmore 1943: 116).
A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money <t>violates</t> the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
I ca n't remember how many times he <t>visited</t> ! DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Source_of_information</fen> is referred to as a source of information related to the current text.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s behavior is in or out of compliance with norms.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that is judged to be in or out of compliance with the <fen>Norm</fen>s.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> may violate a law or rule.
This role identifies the rules or <fen>Norm</fen>s that ought to guide a person's behavior.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the act of compliance or non-compliance occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The sentient entity that is temporarily with the <fen>Entity</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to use for some <fen>Purpose</fen>.  During the visit, the <fen>Agent</fen> matches location with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which a visit is made.
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the visit.
The one who examines a <fen>Text</fen> to understand it.
The entity that contains linguistic symbols.
The idea that an implicit <fen>Text</fen> or texts focuses on.
When the reading event takes place.
Where the reading event takes place.
A complex entity, either an aggregate or a unit, of which a <fen>Part</fen>,  a constituent or a component, is specified.
A component or constituent that is specified to form part of the <fen>Total</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Total</fen> includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Total</fen> includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The accreting matter forms a disc whose instabilities trigger outbursts (see <fex>Lasota 2001</fex> for a review of the instability model).
Jo's <fex><t>violation</t></fex> of the no trespassing law came as a surprise.
John violated <fex>the law</fex> by not paying taxes.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
Charlie often reads the newspaper <fex>at night</fex>.
Surprisingly, few of the students read much at all <fex>in the designated reading rooms</fex>.
The larger album includes <fex>designs for his house at Whitehall</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> the recognized departments included the Russian and East European Institute, and the Office of International Programs.
<fex>In California</fex>, the category excludes minors and the mentally ill.
